articles.title: MAY IN THE YEAR 1978
articles.summary: This document outlines the San Jose Astronomical Association's calendar of events for May and June 1978, featuring various activities such as indoor and outdoor star parties, general meetings with planetarium shows and speakers, and board meetings. It also includes an announcement for the Riverside Telescope Makers Conference. The article serves as an activity schedule for club members and the local astronomical community.

articles.title: Rambling Rhodes
articles.summary: The San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA) is relocating its monthly meetings to the Rosecrucian Planetarium in San Jose, a move spearheaded by Gerry Rattley to establish a beneficial partnership with a local institution. This new association has already yielded positive results, including a successful Astronomy Day, and has prompted a shift in meeting times to a Saturday following the first-quarter moon to prevent conflicts with optimal viewing nights. The club plans to publish the new meeting schedule well in advance to accommodate members.

articles.title: DIRECTIONS TO FREMONT PEAK STATE PARK
articles.summary: This document provides directions to Fremont Peak State Park, instructing visitors to travel south on Highway 101 from Gilroy, then east on Highway 156 to San Juan Bautista. From there, turn right at the flashing yellow light and follow signs up the hill until the park at the road's end, advising caution.

articles.title: DIRECTIONS TO DR. GREGORY'S HOME FOR THE MAY BOARD MEETING, MAY 12 FRIDAY AT 8:00 pm.
articles.summary: This document provides detailed directions to Dr. Gregory's home for a board meeting scheduled for Friday, May 12th, at 8:00 pm. Additionally, it includes a map and information for a general meeting at the Rosicrucian Planetarium on Saturday, May 13th, 1978, at 7:30 pm, noting a change made at a prior board meeting.

articles.title: AD AD AD AD
articles.summary: This article serves as a recruitment announcement, appealing to club members to volunteer as writers for the club's bulletin. It outlines a variety of desired content, including reports on star parties, astronomical news, member stories, and puzzles, emphasizing the need for imagination and willingness to contribute. Additionally, the article features a separate section of humorous quotes from a recent board meeting.

articles.title: Red Spot Predictions
articles.summary: This article provides the final predicted meridian transit times for the Great Red Spot (GRS) during its current apparition, noting it is tracking close to predictions and appears mostly gray or light yellow but is detectable under good seeing conditions. Future recovery observations for the GRS are scheduled for August.

articles.title: For Sale...
articles.summary: This article is a classified advertisement for a DOAA model AD drive corrector, offered for sale by Jim Van Nuland for $45. The device features 120 VAC and 12 VDC power, a variable rate of 50-70 Hz, and 10 watts output. Buyers can choose between a cigarette lighter plug or battery clips, and a plain or stretch cord.

articles.title: The Finest Deep Sky Objects on the Skalnate Pleso Atlas of the Heavens Chart I
articles.summary: This document provides a detailed guide to selected deep-sky objects found on Chart I of the Skalnate Pleso Atlas of the Heavens. It offers specific observational data for various NGC and IC objects, including planetary nebulae, open clusters, and galaxies, detailing their characteristics, magnitudes, sizes, distances, and recommended viewing powers. The guide also includes historical catalogue references and practical tips for amateur astronomers seeking to observe these celestial targets.

articles.title: Finest Skalnate Pleso Objects - Chart I, continued
articles.summary: This document, 'Finest Skalnate Pleso Objects - Chart I, continued,' provides a detailed catalog of deep-sky objects, including galaxies, nebulae, and star clusters. For each NGC object, it lists coordinates, constellation, type, magnitude, size, distance, and historical observational notes, often referencing Herschel. It also offers practical observing advice on recommended magnification and conditions for a rewarding view.

articles.title: Blurbs
articles.summary: This article announces several upcoming events and organizational updates, including Sun Week and Sun Day on May 1-6 at the Rosicrucian Planetarium with telescope viewing. It details the formation of a nominating committee for the June board elections and the appointment of a banquet chair for the July meeting, seeking site suggestions. Additionally, information for the Riverside Telescope Makers Conference (May 27-29) and an opportunity to participate in a "blinking" project are highlighted.

articles.title: ANNOUNCEMENT
articles.summary: The Los Gatos Red Cross is considering hosting unannounced indoor star parties on Saturdays, which will be scheduled once the Board finalizes General Meeting dates and other events are avoided. For current information on these potential events, individuals should contact Ed Schell.

articles.title: History
articles.summary: This article reports on several club activities, including an astronomical egg decorating contest won by Jeff Lo. It details a star party at Fremont Peak where observers witnessed a distant fire in Hollister through a telescope, and a lunar graze expedition near Gilroy. The report also covers a discussion about moving the general meeting location and a presentation on an 11-day Sitmar cruise featuring a total solar eclipse.

articles.title: Editorial
articles.summary: The editor of the Bulletin expresses frustration over the monthly challenges of its production, citing a lack of member contributions, last-minute withdrawals, and persistent technical issues with the xeroxing machine. Despite these difficulties, the editor acknowledges the crucial support of a few dedicated volunteers. Moving forward, the editor announces a proactive plan to solicit articles and information from members to build a backlog for future issues.
